name: drawling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
drawl
to speak in a slow way in which the vowel sounds are made longer and words are not separated clearly: [ + speech ] "Hey, what's the rush? Slow down, baby!" he drawled.
More examplesFewer examples Then the hulking man in the tall chair leans toward his anxious guest and drawls, "Do you wanna hear what I think?" a middle-aged Texan with a drawling western accent "Honey, I am too old and too rich," she drawled.
